alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 10:18PM EST until January 04 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE... Mercer County in central New Jersey... Monmouth County in central New Jersey... Middlesex County in northern New Jersey... Somerset County in northern New Jersey... Southeastern Hunterdon County in northwestern New Jersey... Northeastern Burlington County in southern New Jersey... Northwestern Ocean County in southern New Jersey... Eastern Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Eastern Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Northeastern Philadelphia County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * WHEN...Until 130 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1017 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain in much of the advisory area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Toms River, Trenton, New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Long Branch, Asbury Park, Somerville, Sandy Hook, Somerset, Edison, and Lakewood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
